intro: Marsdenia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals with a distinctive yellowish color. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
